claim: Examination of the dorsum of her left hand revealed a 20-mm diameter circular wound with a bed of granulation tissue, proximal to the first metacarpophalangeal joint (Figure 1).
title: Figure 1.
caption: Preoperative image taken during the time of operation, 18 days after application of the ointment, revealing a 20-mm circular defect distal to the first metacarpophalangeal joint.

claim: The postoperative period was uneventful and hand function was fully restored six weeks after surgery (Figure 4).
title: Figure 4.
caption: Postoperative image taken six weeks after surgery showing a well-healed rhomboid flap covering the entirety of the previous defect.

claim: The flap margin marked A was transposed to align with the wound margin marked a.Figure 3.
title: Figure 3.
caption: Image of the transposed rhomboid flap now covering the wound bed and sutured into place using single non-resorbable nylon sutures.
